original_title: Sri Lanka to allow spice imports for value added products
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will allow the import of spices to produce value added products for export, following requests from Board of Investment approved companies, a government statement said.
The cabinet of ministers had approved the plan to import selected spices which will be used to extract oil and oleoresins.
The products made with extracts allow high revenues to be earned than exports in raw form, the statement said.
Sri Lanka has trade restrictions for domestically produced items including tea. (Colombo/Dec19/2023)
